meanings.definition: Lacking flavor or zest; flat; insipid.
meanings.sent1: The soup tasted mawk, with no spices or herbs to liven it up.
meanings.sent2: The plain rice was so mawk that even a pinch of salt would have helped.
meanings.sent3: She found the mawk sandwich so boring that she pretended it was a cardboard cutout.
meanings.sent4: The mawk performance of the play left the audience yawning in their seats.
meanings.sent5: The mawk landscape stretched out before them, devoid of any color or excitement.

meanings.definition: To be sick or disgusted; to feel nausea.
meanings.sent1: The smell of rotten eggs made her mawk and run to the bathroom.
meanings.sent2: He started to mawk after eating the spoiled food from the fridge.
meanings.sent3: The idea of eating snails made her mawk, but she tried them anyway.
meanings.sent4: The sight of the slimy creature made her mawk as if she had swallowed a frog.
meanings.sent5: The roller coaster ride made her mawk, but she couldn't stop laughing afterwards.
